direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods remove elements from the queue but return different results (remove returns the head element, poll returns null if the queue is empty).
Both methods interact with the queue and use synchronization mechanisms.
Both methods handle cases where the queue is empty, though they throw different exceptions.
Both methods interact with the head of the queue but have different behaviors (peek does not remove the element).

enhanced_by.reason: The method initializes the queue which is necessary for the remove method to operate.
Adding elements to the queue is necessary to test the remove method.
The peek method can be used to verify the state of the queue after the remove operation.
